revised_title: The Influence of High Oxygen Pressure on Carrot Respiration and Metabolism
tldr: The author's study on the respiratory and carbohydrate metabolism of plant tissues, specifically carrots, shows that oxygen at high pressures can stimulate and inhibit certain pathways of respiration. The tricarboxylic acid cycle was found to operate in intact carrots, and the initial stimulation of CO2 output in oxygen was followed by a progressive inhibition. This research provides insights into the complex interaction of oxygen on plant respiration and metabolism.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
